title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement [INSERT CONTACT METHOD]. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/ code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to ffopportunity
text: outlines propose change ffopportunity. detailed info contributing , tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide.

title: Contributing to ffopportunity
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to ffopportunity
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to ffopportunity
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("ffverse/ffopportunity", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to ffopportunity
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to ffopportunity
text: Please note ffopportunity project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Expected Rushing Yards
text: ### Partial Dependence Plots

title: Authors and Citation
text: Joe Sydlowski. Author, maintainer, copyright holder. Tan Ho. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Sydlowski J, Ho T (2025). ffopportunity: Models Fantasy Football Expected Points. R package version 0.1.0.07, https://ffopportunity.ffverse.com.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ffopportunity: Models for Fantasy Football Expected Points},   author = {Joe Sydlowski and Tan Ho},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0.07},   url = {https://ffopportunity.ffverse.com}, }

what: Expected Points Models for Fantasy Football
title: Expected Points Models for Fantasy Football
text: Models Data Expected Fantasy Points ffopportunity builds dataframe Expected Fantasy Points preprocessing applying xgboost model nflverse play--play data. also includes utilities download precomputed data automated GitHub releases.

title: Expected Points Models for Fantasy Football
text: Expected Fantasy Points measure player opportunities fantasy football - essentially aiming quantify many points average player score given specific situation opportunity. uses xgboost tidymodels trained public nflverse data 2006-2020 . modeling details, see articles posted website: https://ffopportunity.ffverse.com/articles/

title: Expected Points Models for Fantasy Football
text: Install development version GitHub :
code: install.packages("ffopportunity", repos = c("https://ffverse.r-universe.dev", getOption("repos")))  # or use remotes/devtools # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("ffverse/ffopportunity")

title: Expected Points Models for Fantasy Football
text: two main functions {ffopportunity} ep_load() ep_build(). can download latest version EP data ep_load() follows: can also build EP base nflverse data ep_build() follows:
code: library(ffopportunity) #> Warning: package 'ffopportunity' was built under R version 4.2.1 ep_load(season = 2020:2021, type = "weekly") #> → <ffopportunity predictions> #> → Generated 2022-09-12 12:59:18 with ep model version "latest" #> # A tibble: 11,769 × 159 #>    season posteam  week game_id  playe…¹ full_…² posit…³ pass_…⁴ rec_a…⁵ rush_…⁶ #>    <chr>  <chr>   <dbl> <chr>    <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> #>  1 2020   SF          1 2020_01… 00-003… Jimmy … QB           33       0       1 #>  2 2020   SF          1 2020_01… 00-003… George… TE            0       5       1 #>  3 2020   ARI         1 2020_01… 00-003… Kyler … QB           39       0      11 #>  4 2020   ARI         1 2020_01… 00-003… DeAndr… WR            0      16       0 #>  5 2020   ARI         1 2020_01… 00-002… Larry … WR            0       5       0 #>  6 2020   ARI         1 2020_01… <NA>    <NA>    <NA>          0       2       0 #>  7 2020   SF          1 2020_01… 00-003… Raheem… RB            0       5      15 #>  8 2020   ARI         1 2020_01… 00-003… Kenyan… RB            0       2      16 #>  9 2020   ARI         1 2020_01… 00-003… Christ… WR            0       5       0 #> 10 2020   SF          1 2020_01… 00-003… Trent … WR            0       5       0 #> # … with 11,759 more rows, 149 more variables: pass_air_yards <dbl>, #> #   rec_air_yards <dbl>, pass_completions <dbl>, receptions <dbl>, #> #   pass_completions_exp <dbl>, receptions_exp <dbl>, pass_yards_gained <dbl>, #> #   rec_yards_gained <dbl>, rush_yards_gained <dbl>, #> #   pass_yards_gained_exp <dbl>, rec_yards_gained_exp <dbl>, #> #   rush_yards_gained_exp <dbl>, pass_touchdown <dbl>, rec_touchdown <dbl>, #> #   rush_touchdown <dbl>, pass_touchdown_exp <dbl>, rec_touchdown_exp <dbl>, … #> # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows, and `colnames()` to see all variable names ep_build(season = 2021, version = "latest") #> -- Starting ep build for 2021 season(s)! 2022-01-11 07:58:44 ------------------- #> > Loading pbp 2022-01-11 07:58:44 #> > Preprocessing pbp 2022-01-11 07:58:46 #> > Generating predictions 2022-01-11 07:58:54 #> > Summarizing data 2022-01-11 07:59:33 #> -- Finished building ep for 2021 season(s)! 2022-01-11 07:59:33 ---------------- #> > <ffopportunity predictions> #> > Generated 2022-01-11 07:59:33 with model version latest #> List of 5 #>  $ ep_weekly  : tibble [5,756 x 159] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>  $ ep_pbp_pass: tibble [18,747 x 57] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.table/data.frame) #>  $ ep_pbp_rush: tibble [14,038 x 47] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.table/data.frame) #>  $ ep_version : chr "latest" #>  $ timestamp  : POSIXct[1:1], format: "2022-01-11 07:59:33"

title: Pull nflreadr rosters — .get_rosters
text: Pull nflreadr rosters

title: Pull nflreadr rosters — .get_rosters
text: seasons choose season range seasons

title: Build EP — ep_build
text: function builds Expected Fantasy Points predictions downloading xgboost models play--play data, applying model, summarizing player level.

title: Build EP — ep_build
text: season numeric vector seasons defaults recent season. Must later 2006. version EP model version - one "latest" (default) "v1.0.0" (currently identical)

title: Build EP — ep_build
text: list containing three dataframes: ep_weekly provides game-level summary player, ep_pbp_pass provides EP data pass plays, ep_pbp_rush provides EP data rush plays.

title: Build EP — ep_build
code: # \donttest{ try({ # prevents cran-related errors   ep_build(season = 2021) }) #> ── Starting ep build for 2021 season(s)! 2025-09-10 01:33:19.743752 ──────────── #> → Downloading EP models, if required 2025-09-10 01:33:19.749004 #> ℹ Could not find ep model version "latest" in cache directory:  #> ~/.cache/ffopportunity  #> ℹ Attempting download #> ✔ Successfully downloaded ep model version "latest" to cache! #> → Loading pbp 2025-09-10 01:33:21.071556 #> → Preprocessing pbp 2025-09-10 01:33:25.133439 #> → Generating predictions 2025-09-10 01:33:36.245826 #> → Summarizing data 2025-09-10 01:33:37.060103 #> ── Finished building ep for 2021 season(s)! 2025-09-10 01:33:37.063812 ───────── #> → <ffopportunity predictions> #> → Generated 2025-09-10 01:33:37.068305 with model version latest #> List of 5 #>  $ ep_weekly  : tibble [6,065 × 159] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>  $ ep_pbp_pass: nflvrs_d [19,769 × 57] (S3: nflverse_data/tbl_df/tbl/data.table/data.frame) #>  $ ep_pbp_rush: nflvrs_d [15,164 × 50] (S3: nflverse_data/tbl_df/tbl/data.table/data.frame) #>  $ ep_version : chr "latest" #>  $ timestamp  : POSIXct[1:1], format: "2025-09-10 01:33:37" # }

title: Model versioning — ep_cache_models
text: function checks cache previously downloaded model (optionally) tries download model GitHub release.

title: Model versioning — ep_cache_models
code: ep_cache_models(   version = c("latest", "v1.0.0"),   force = FALSE,   ask = interactive() )

title: Model versioning — ep_cache_models
text: version one "latest" "v1.0.0" - currently refer thing force TRUE FALSE - forces download regardless currently existing ask TRUE FALSE - ask downloading - force skip .

title: Model versioning — ep_cache_models
text: status message attempting download model.

title: Load Expected Points data — ep_load
text: function downloads precomputed expected points data ffopportunity automated releases.

title: Load Expected Points data — ep_load
code: ep_load(   season = nflreadr::most_recent_season(),   type = c("weekly", "pbp_pass", "pbp_rush"),   version = c("latest", "v1.0.0") )

title: Load Expected Points data — ep_load
text: season numeric vector four digit years associated given NFL seasons - defaults latest season. type Data type - one "weekly", "pbp_pass", "pbp_rush" version EP model version: one "latest" (default) "v1.0.0" - currently identical.

title: Load Expected Points data — ep_load
text: dataframe identical returned ffopportunity::ep_build() given season.

title: Load Expected Points data — ep_load

title: Tidy eval helpers — tidyeval
text: learn tidy eval use tools, visit https://tidyeval.tidyverse.org Metaprogramming section Advanced R.

title: ffopportunity (development version)
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Added ep_build() initial subfunctions preprocess, predict, summarise EP Added ep_load_*() download release data Added update/ script uses piggyback update release data Offloaded models releases (“latest-models”, “v1.0.0-models”) Added download models user cache Combine variants ep_load one function ep_load() arguments Rename ffopportunity Include spikes kneel downs tie official stats ep_summarize() Fix YAC bug pbp_pass data
